title: Thai Ginger Chicken
description: A delicious Thai ginger chicken stir-fry featuring marinated chicken tossed in a tangy, flavorful sauce with crisp vegetables.
overview: Thai Ginger Chicken stir-fry with marinated chicken, aromatic ginger and garlic, and a tangy sauce.

ingredients.title: The Sauce
content: 2 tbsp Fermented soy bean paste (or Korean soybean paste)

ingredients.title: Stir Fry
content: 8 Wood Ear Mushrooms, cut into small pieces (optional)

stages.title: Step 1: Chicken Marination
content: Cut the chicken into bite-sized pieces; remove the skin if desired.
Mix the chicken with 1 1/2 tbsp Light Soy Sauce and set aside.

stages.title: Step 2: Make Sauce
content: In a small bowl, combine 1 tsp sugar, 1 tsp toasted sesame oil, 1 tsp white pepper, 1 tbsp dark soy sauce, 2 tbsp fermented soy bean paste, 2 tbsp oyster sauce, and 2 tbsp water. Mix well and set aside.

stages.title: Step 3: Stir Fry
content: Heat 3 tbsp oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat.
Stir-fry the garlic and red (spur) chili for 30 seconds.
Add the marinated chicken and stir-fry until fully cooked, about 5-10 minutes.
Add the ginger and stir-fry for an additional 2-3 minutes.
Pour the prepared sauce over the chicken and stir-fry until the sauce is evenly distributed, about 2-3 minutes.
Add the wood ear mushrooms and onion, and stir-fry for an additional 3-4 minutes.
Stir-fry the spur chilies for 1 minute, then add the spring onions and give the dish a final mix.

stages.title: Step 4: Assemble
content: Serve the Thai Ginger Chicken over steamed jasmine rice.
